intro: Angelica morrisonicola var. nanhutashanensis, commonly known as the Nanhutashan angelica, is a rare and endemic species native to China. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and compound leaves. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions with high humidity and cool temperatures. It features tall, hollow stems and large, feather-like leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered, often producing a distinctive, spicy fragrance.
